# English Stop Words

> A list of English [stop words][stopwords].

<section class="intro">

</section>

<!-- /.intro -->

<section class="usage">

## Usage

```javascript
var stopwords = require( '@stdlib/datasets/stopwords-en' );
```

#### stopwords()

Returns a list of 301 english [stop words][stopwords].

```javascript
var list = stopwords();
/* returns
    [
        'a',
        'about',
        'above',
        'across',
        'actually',
        ...
    ]
*/
```

</section>

<!-- /.usage -->

<section class="examples">

## Examples

```javascript
var floor = require( '@stdlib/math/base/special/floor' );
var randu = require( '@stdlib/random/base/randu' );
var stopwords = require( '@stdlib/datasets/stopwords-en' );

var list = stopwords();
var len = list.length;
var idx;
var i;

// Select random words from the list...
for ( i = 0; i < 100; i++ ) {
    idx = floor( randu()*len );
    console.log( list[ idx ] );
}
```

</section>

<!-- /.examples -->

* * *

<section class="cli">

## CLI

<section class="usage">

### Usage

```text
Usage: stopwords-en [options]

Options:

  -h,    --help                Print this message.
  -V,    --version             Print the package version.
```

</section>

<!-- /.usage -->

<section class="examples">

### Examples

```bash
$ stopwords-en
a
about
above
across
actually
...
```

</section>

<!-- /.examples -->

</section>

<!-- /.cli -->
